refnamediv.refpurpose: Accesses table values by direct indexing.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Accesses table values by direct indexing.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: ares table andx, ifn [, ixmode] [, ixoff] [, iwrap]
ires table indx, ifn [, ixmode] [, ixoff] [, iwrap]
kres table kndx, ifn [, ixmode] [, ixoff] [, iwrap]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para:
ixmode (optional) -- index data mode. The default value is 0.
0 = raw index
1 = normalized (0 to 1)
ixoff (optional) -- amount by which index is to be offset. For a table with origin at center, use tablesize/2 (raw) or .5 (normalized). The default value is 0.

iwrap (optional) -- wraparound index flag. The default value is 0.
0 = nowrap (index < 0 treated as index=0; index > tablesize sticks at index=size)
1 = wraparound.

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: table invokes table lookup on behalf of init, control or audio indices. These indices can be raw entry numbers (0,l,2...size - 1) or scaled values (0 to 1-e). Indices are first modified by the offset value then checked for range before table lookup (see iwrap). If index is likely to be full scale, or if interpolation is being used, the table should have an extended guard point. table indexed by a periodic phasor ( see phasor) will simulate an oscillator.
